thread.title: Craft Breweries Multiply in the Finger Lakes
thread.title_full: Craft Breweries Multiply in the Finger Lakes - The New York Times

author: Ben Jay
title: Craft Breweries Multiply in the Finger Lakes
text:
The Finger Lakes in western New York State have long been a top destination for wine lovers, but the region is quickly becoming a haven for beer drinkers as well. It is home to 70 breweries, according to Finger Lakes Beer Trail , a local trade group, up from just 24 in 2011. Twelve more are scheduled to open in the next few months.
LyonSmith Brewing Co. in Penn Yan opened its doors in April, while Seneca Lake Brewing Co. in Rock Stream is set to open its tasting room soon. Both focus exclusively on British styles.
“Our region’s craft brews are unique from other areas of the U.S. in that our breweries are very fortunate to have access to fresh, clean water; locally grown hops; malted barley; and other ingredients,” Theresa Hollister, a founding partner of the Finger Lakes Beer Trail, wrote in an email.
